factoid: Princess Drubetskáya is an elderly lady.
Princess Drubetskáya belongs to one of the best families in Russia.
Princess Drubetskáya is poor.
Princess Drubetskáya has lost her former influential connections.
Princess Drubetskáya came to Petersburg to procure an appointment in the Guards for her only son.
Princess Drubetskáya obtained an invitation to Anna Pávlovna’s reception solely to meet Prince Vasíli.
Princess Drubetskáya sat listening to the vicomte’s story at the reception.
Prince Vasíli is a prince.
Prince Vasíli answered that he is ready to do all he can.
Prince Vasíli said it is difficult for him to ask the Emperor.
Prince Vasíli advised Princess Drubetskáya to appeal to Rumyántsev through Prince Golítsyn.
Prince Vasíli said that appealing to Rumyántsev through Prince Golítsyn would be the best way.
Prince Vasíli’s words frightened Princess Drubetskáya.
Princess Drubetskáya smiled again and clutched Prince Vasíli’s arm more tightly.
Princess Drubetskáya said she has never asked Prince Vasíli for anything.
Princess Drubetskáya said she will never ask again.
Princess Drubetskáya said she never reminded Prince Vasíli of her father's friendship for him.
Princess Drubetskáya entreats Prince Vasíli to do something for her son.
Princess Drubetskáya says she will always regard Prince Vasíli as a benefactor.
Princess Drubetskáya says she has asked Prince Golítsyn and he has refused.
Princess Drubetskáya says be the kindhearted man you always were.
Princess Hélène said we shall be late.
Prince Vasíli knows that influence in society is a capital which has to be economized.
Prince Vasíli realized that if he asked on behalf of all who begged of him, he would soon be unable to ask for himself.
Prince Vasíli became chary of using his influence.
Prince Vasíli felt qualms of conscience after Princess Drubetskáya’s second appeal.
Princess Drubetskáya reminded Prince Vasíli of what was quite true.
Prince Vasíli had been indebted to Princess Drubetskáya’s father for the first steps in his career.
Prince Vasíli could see by Princess Drubetskáya’s manners that she was one of those women who, once made up her mind, will not rest until she has gained her end.
Prince Vasíli could see that Princess Drubetskáya is prepared if necessary to go on insisting day after day and hour after hour, and even to make scenes.
Prince Vasíli was moved by this consideration.
Prince Vasíli said it is almost impossible for him to do what Princess Drubetskáya asks.
Prince Vasíli said he will do the impossible: Princess Drubetskáya’s son shall be transferred to the Guards.
Prince Vasíli said he will do it.
Princess Drubetskáya is satisfied with Prince Vasíli’s promise.
Princess Drubetskáya says she knows his kindness.
Princess Drubetskáya says when her son has been transferred to the Guards...
Princess Drubetskáya says she is on good terms with Michael Ilariónovich Kutúzov.
Princess Drubetskáya recommends Borís to Michael Ilariónovich Kutúzov as adjutant.
Princess Drubetskáya says then she will be at rest.
Prince Vasíli smiles.
Prince Vasíli says he will not promise to recommend Borís to Kutúzov.
Prince Vasíli says Michael Ilariónovich Kutúzov is pestered since his appointment as Commander in Chief.
Prince Vasíli says all the Moscow ladies have conspired to give him all their sons as adjutants.
Princess Drubetskáya says do promise.
Princess Drubetskáya says do promise, do promise, Vasíli.
Anna Mikháylovna cries.
Anna Mikháylovna has a smile of a coquettish girl.
Anna Mikháylovna’s smile was probably natural at one time but now ill-suited to her careworn face.
Anna Mikháylovna’s age was forgotten by her.
Anna Mikháylovna employed all old feminine arts by habit.
Anna Mikháylovna’s face resumed its former cold, artificial expression after Prince Vasíli left.
Anna Mikháylovna returned to the group where the vicomte was still talking.
Anna Mikháylovna pretended to listen while waiting for the time to leave.
Anna Mikháylovna’s task was accomplished.
